definition: to amass wealth while keeping a low profile (idiom)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
the shot hits the bird that pokes its head out (idiom)/nonconformity gets punished

lit. people fear getting famous like pigs fear fattening up (for the slaughter)/fig. fame has its price

definition: lit. a tall tree attracts the wind (idiom)/fig. a famous or rich person attracts criticism
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
lit. to not show the mountain and to not reveal the water (idiom); fig. to hide the key facts

definition: both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
